Module: general-utils

A tessel-kit module that provides general purpose utility functions.
Source:
  • general-utils.js, line 11

Methods

(inner) coalesceOnEmpty()

Returns the given value, if not empty; otherwise, returns the given defaultValue.
Source:
  • general-utils.js, line 40

(inner) coalesceOnNull()

Returns the given value, if not null or undefined; otherwise, returns the given defaultValue.
Source:
  • general-utils.js, line 49

(inner) copyProperties(source, target)

Copy all properties that are directly owned by the given source object (i.e., hasOwnProperty) to the given target object.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
source object to copy methods and properties from.
target object to copy methods and properties to.
Source:
  • general-utils.js, line 123

(inner) getArgumentValue()

Return the commandline argument specified by argumentName. If not found, then return the specified defaultValue. Example commandline: "tessel run app/app.js climatePort=A foo=1.23 bar=4.56" Example Usages (for the commandline shown above): // returns "1.23" tesselKit.tesselUtils.getArgumentValue("foo", "asdfgh"); // returns "qwerty" tesselKit.tesselUtils.getArgumentValue("test", "qwerty");
Source:
  • general-utils.js, line 155

(inner) getProperties(obj, maxNumProperties) → {string}

Return a String, of the form "propertyName = propertyValue\n", for every property of the given obj, or until maxNumProperties has been reached.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
obj object to retrieve the properties from.
maxNumProperties optional limiter for the number of properties to retrieve.
Source:
  • general-utils.js, line 86
Returns:
new-line separated set of property/value pairs
Type
string

(inner) isEmpty(value) → {boolean|*}

Returns true if the given value is undefined, null, an empty String or an Object with a length property that's zero (e.g., a zero-length array).
Parameters:
Name Type Description
value to be tested
